headline: Chef John's Classic Beef Stroganoff
description: This classic beef stroganoff recipe is made rich with chuck roast, mushrooms, and white wine. Crème fraîche adds a deliciously creamy finishing touch.

video.description: Watch Chef John prepare his secret recipe for creamy beef stroganoff.
video.name: Classic Beef Stroganoff

name: Chef John's Classic Beef Stroganoff
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds beef chuck roast, cut into 1/2-inch thick strips

recipeInstructions.text: Season beef generously with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat until nearly smoking. Stir in beef; cook, stirring constantly, for 6 to 7 minutes, until liquid evaporates and meat browns.
Remove meat from the pan and set aside. Stir mushrooms, onions, and butter into the pan; cook and stir over medium heat until vegetables are lightly browned.

Add garlic and stir for 30 seconds. Stir in flour; cook for 1 to 2 minutes until incorporated. Stir in wine and 1 cup of broth, scraping the bottom of the pan to release any browned bits. Bring to a simmer and cook until the sauce thickens, about 3 to 4 minutes.
Return beef to the pan. Stir in remaining cup of broth; bring to a simmer and cook on low heat for about 1 hour, covered, until beef is tender and sauce is thick. Stir every 20 minutes.
Stir in crème fraîche. Stir in chives. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

review.reviewBody: I didn't change a thing. So creamy, so yummy. I'll never make it any other way!
Perfect recipe.

Usually Chef John uses the highest quality ingredients, but this is like a stew with sour cream. I use thin strips of eye of round steak or sirloin steak or NY Strip steak cooked only to rare in butter in small batches, drain and retain the meat juices to add back to gravy. Put a strainer over a large measuring cup to catch meat juice. Then cook mushrooms, garlic and onion in butter, add flour and add meat juices and broth as needed to make gravy. Sometimes a spoon of horseradish too. Add back meat and gently warm. Remove from heat and blend in sour cream. To me, the trick is to cook your meat only to rare or medium rare to have it tender and juicy.
Made it pretty faithfully to the recipe, but due to some of my GF's dietary restrictions, I went about 1/3 light on the Creme Fraiche. Still rocked. GF like it so much, it was like a new date night.
Love it
This came out great! I'll make it again as the recipe calls for, except I had to use sour cream.

Love this recipe. I have made Stroganoff in the past with sour cream and this is my favorite. I totally prefer the creme fraiche. I read the reviews of some poeple saying they didn't like it. I wonder if they didn't cook it right or are just simply stupid? I mean come on.. The deep rich beef flavor along with savory mushrooms on top of a buttered egg noodle.. What is not to like? I made this last weekend and the only problem was that there just wasn't enough of it. So, right now, I am making a double batch of it(kind of expensive with 4 lbs of grass fed chuck roast at $50, owwy). Easily one of my favorite recipes. I will probably make this the rest of my life.

I made the recipe per specification. I can only state the taste was mediocre. Problem 1 is my view, this is a lower quality main course comparable to lower level spaghetti alla carbonara (coal miner's spaghetti). Problem 2 is the quality of the meat, the chuck roast, which negatively impacted taste. Triple chuck meat would be excellent for hamburgers, spaghetti meat sauce and Mexican albondigas soup but not stroganoff. If I were inspired to make this recipe again, which I doubt, I would try ribeye roast or ribeye steak. Problem 3: Why place chives in the recipe when its' onion flavor already existed with chopped onions. Problem 4. Why wine? If to tenderize the meat, there would be no need with a higher quality meat source such as ribeye. if the purpose of the wine were flavor, no need if using a higher quality meat source. Problem 5: The add-in of creme fraiche made for a concoction which had the appearance of glop. While my opinion is in the minority, I consider myself a good amateur chef and could not advocate this recipe.

I have no idea if it's me or this recipe. I've been making stroganoff for over 30 years with a family recipe. Decided to try something different and I must say I am not a fan. This recipe came out very watery with not much flavor. I should have listened to the one reviewer who said that they did not add more beef broth at the end. I'll be going back to the family recipe.
simple, delicious.
I love Chef John! I’ve made it a couple times,always a hit,five star ⭐️ recipe!
Wonderful recipe. Followed it exactly except I used a full cup of sour cream rather than 3/4. Family loved it.

Chef John never disappoints!! I used store-bought creme fraiche only because I’ve never had enough forward thinking to have supplies to make my own but it was still bowl licking delicious. Served over egg noodles and with a side of broccoli, even my toddler devoured the leftovers. Thanks for another great recipe!
perfection...... i also make this with both chicken and pork too
This recipe is great. I made it exactly according to the instructions with 1 exception. When it came time to simmer I moved it to a crock pot for 6 hours. Beef was tender and the flavor was great.
Delicious--my Mom used to add sherry to her stroganoff--so I added that to this.
If you're used to box stroganoff you might not like this recipe. That is unless you like the taste of real food! This recipe is amazing! Take the time to make the cream fraiche. It's worth it!
Once again Chef John comes through! My only changes were using scallions instead of chives, and Merlot red wine instead of white wine. This was rich and delicious! Thank you, Chef John!

This was sooo incredibly delicious. I doubled the recipe, as we had a large group. You HAVE to watch the video, where is stresses how you have to let the water cook completely off the meet. Then you must cook off all the liquid from the mushrooms and onions. Both of these took quite a while with the large amount I had, but WOW, what flavor! Everyone LOVED it and this recipe is going down as a new favorite.

I will make this again, but next time will use chuck roast instead of stew beef from CostCo and make it in a stainless steel pan. I used a non-stick which didn't give as good a sear or provide much fond.
Absolutely the best stroganoff recipe I have ever made!

Everyone loved it! I changed it up with a can of Cambells mushroom soup, and extra mushrooms, pepper, and garlic. substituted "Very low sodium chicken stock " for beef. Kinda winging it, with the amounts. I skipped the salt since the Cambells has enough salt for 10 people. There was so much water in the beef it took much longer to boil off and thicken up. It never really browned the beef, more like boiled it. Put it over thick spaghetti vice egg noodles. So, it's all gone in one sitting, no wonder why I never get out of the kitchen. LOL
Good recipe, used red wine as that's all I had. Good flavor and rich "gravy".
Excellent. I added a tablespoon of Dijon mustard, two tablespoons of Worcestershire Sauce and thyme
Excellent, my wife and I enjoyed this recipe very much. Made it just like the video & recipe. Chef John is a fantastic chef and we have been a fan for years.
I made it for the fourth time. I did add some cream cheese that added a little more contrasting flavor.
This was absolutely delicious. I followed the recipe exactly using Greek yogurt instead of creme fraiche. My family loved it. Thank you!
My favorite Chef John recipe. Making it again tonight. Great on a cold winter night

I made this last night. It is absolutely delicious. I substituted red wine for the white wine because that’s what was open. It turned out fantastic. I also added a few dashes of cinnamon to the recipe because it brings out the beef taste. I also added a couple tablespoons of sour cream at the end as well. As I like that slight sour taste tang. It’s relatively easy to make. I will definitely make it again. My husband normally doesn’t like beef stroganoff but loved this.
Best recipe ever absolutely delicious
Used crema mexicana instead of creme fraiche. And served it with steam broccoli, delicious!
Awesome recipe.

Instant top 5. I found Chef John this time last year and his mushroom gravy made the holiday season great.
Today, Sunday inspiration, I came across Chef John again. 
Key: Get the Chuck (pot) roast beef. This beef cut when braised comes out soft and delicious. I am a big slow cooked pot roast guy. Against my instinct to avoid over cooking I finally realized it is best to cook pot roast low and long to make it fall-apart soft.

I did not have time to make the Crème Fraîche and my local market did not have it. Instead I used mascarpone to avoid sour cream curdling. It worked. 
Next time I will plan ahead and make the super simple Crème Fraîche with heavy cream and cultured buttermilk.

The picture shown is post-family-gobbling not much left...

Excellent work Chef John!
Loved it! Doubled the sauce.
We substitute Toffutti sour cream equivalent since we're working around a dairy allergy. Also added 1.5 TBs Worcestershire sauce to bring in a slight tang to the flavor.
delicious!

This recipe is AMAZING!

Then again, most of Chef John's recipes are! Thank you for sharing.
Delicious as is but add in a chopped dill pickle at the end to really elevate the final dish.
Flavor wasn’t as strong as I would have preferred.

This was fantastic stroganoff. I used stew beef (that was chuck) since it was what I had on hand. Wanted it today so bought Creme Fraiche rather than making my own. Tender meat, thick silky sauce. Perfect. I think I'd add more mushrooms and onion next time but that is just personal preference.
Sooo good. Made exactly as written.
Fantastic!!!!
Made it Almost exactly as written but added what, to me, is a key ingredient-- Worcestershire sauce! Added ~1 Tbsp with the broth.

The best Beef Stroganoff!!!

Added extra mushrooms and cracked the lid when in the oven. Perfect.
It was quite good. Will make again.
As written 3 stars. Four stars with some seasoning! It was bland so I added some thyme and garlic salt at the end.
Very good! Cooked a bit longer than recipe called for as hubby cut roast in larger pieces. Lots of flavor! Served with buttered egg noodles and ‘everything’ garlic toast. Awesome!

First I made a mushroom broth by roasting crimini, shitake and baby bell mushrooms in the oven with olive oil, onion and smashed garlic. I then added this mixture to my Dutch oven with 2 quarts chicken bone broth, bay leaf and fresh thyme and simmered for 30 minutes. I strained and reserved the broth and mushrooms and browned the chuck in batches before frying .5 lbs of bacon. I removed most of the grease and sweated shallots and garlic before adding tomato paste to brown. I then added 2 tbsp of flour and cooked for 2 minutes. I deglazed with 1 cup of white wine before adding 3 cups of mushroom broth. I reduced for 10 minutes before adding the mushrooms and chuck back into the pot and simmered for 1.5 hours. Finished off with homemade crême fraiche chives. So bomb
This was delicious. Next time I will make creme fraiche.
I used a piece of round steak from my freezer instead of the chuck. Both my husband and I enjoyed it. Would make again.
I very much enjoy following Chef John and I have not tried a recipe that I have not enjoyed. this is one of my favorite.
Excellent!! This stuff has an incredible taste!

Followed the recipe but cut it in half. Turned out fantastic, hubs loved it! The meat was tender and the sauce was wonderful. I used chuck roast and the crème fraiche, definitely serve over large buttered noodles. Thanks Chef!
I have to remember to avoid recipes where the first step says "season with salt and pepper to taste." I need clearer direction.
Food make good good in tummy
I've made this recipe a dozen times for my family and we love it! It lends well to stew meat since it simmers for so long. I omit the cream altogether because my family isn't into it.

This stuff is really good! It has the perfect beef stroganoff flavor! I do not imbibe, so I do not include the wine; I just replace it with a little more beef broth. Once it is all added together, I let it simmer about two hours rather than one. The meat turns out very tender and tasty. I have experimented with both chuck roast and ribeye steaks and the chuck roast has a little better flavor and comes out a little more tender. I serve over egg noodles and it is a definite hit! Thank you for sharing, Chef John! You are very talented!!

This was not my momma's beef stroganoff! Who knew this could seem decadent. A labor of love, took a while, but it was tender and totally worth it. Even better the next day. Crème Fraîche seals the deal - but it's good to read other reviews that scale back on meat and other "luxuries" that say it's still delicious. I guess they are the David Hasslehoff of their beef stroganoff!

This was by far the best and simplest stroganoff recipe I have ever made with amazing results! I followed the recipe exactly as stated and only added a sprinkle of worcestershire sauce to flavor the meat. I will be making this again soon!
This was really good and easy to make. I did have to use sour cream as I couldn’t find creme fraiche at the store I went to. I also added more seasoning, onion powder and garlic salt.
Absolutely the bet beef stroganoff ever! This is now my signature dish. It always gets rave reviews!!
Really good recipe. Family loved it. Followed it exactly. Thank you Chef John.

The only adjustment I made was sour cream. It was delicious and since it was my first attempt at beef stroganoff, I am definitely calling it my ONLY recipe for stroganoff! So easy and will make regularly. Thanks Chef John!!! Love your recipes! Time for you to have your own food network show !!!!

When I think of decadent food, I never thought of Beef Stroganoff until now. It was over milky and buttery mash potatoes.
I wanted to use up some of my takeout Chinese Mushroom Sichuan, leftover prime rib, and beef stock (oxtail.)
I used sour cream, that was the only change that I made but everyone in the family enjoyed this recipe it was really good.

Ingredients are not balanced. 
Caused sauce to be too thick and toooo much meat for the amount and liquidity of the sauce. 
Start by Cuttingly the meat in half.

Another great recipe from Chef John. The key is slicing the beef against the grain and making thin cuts. I added a little Worcestershire sauce to give it a little kick. 

Absolutely delicious. 

Pete
My family loves this recipe and requests it a couple times a month. We like more sauce so I double that and serve over egg noodles.

The grocery store was out of beef chuck so I used their stew beef. Simmering for an hour made the beef fall apart tender. I used more mushrooms than called for. This dish disappeared quickly!! We will be making this again in the future.

This was so good! I used stew beef and sour cream, and made sure to butter my noodles. I hate mushrooms but love mushroom flavor. I cut them small thinking they would blend in, next time I’ll leave them bigger so I can eat around them. But 5 for 5 on flavor!
Great recipe. I used leftover cooked prime rib, so only simmered for 25 min.
Very good and will be eating it again!!! Ty
12/17/20 - good flavor, I used cream cheese instead of creme fraiche but turned out great. Served over egg noodles.

I made a huge mistake and diced the mushroom, it really needs to be sliced. Also mind made SO much sauce. I ended up not putting the cover on while it simmered, hoping to reduce it down. I think that was due to the mushrooms not soaking up the sauce because they were diced. This made close to 7-8 servings for us. The beef was still chewy, IMO it could use longer than an hour simmering.

I loved this recipe. I own a restaurant and work long hours so I don't like to spend alot of time in the kitchen at home. I adapted this easily for the pressure cooker and it was done in 20 min. The white wine definitely adds a great layer of flavor. Don't skip this step. I used a nice chardonnay. I browned my 1 inch cubed chuck roast in a cast iron skillet then transferred to the pressure cooker. I sauteed crimini and baby bella mushrooms with the onion and a little shallot and after sauteed I added garlic. I used about 14 oz of mushrooms but it's personal preference. Transferred all to the pot. Skipped the flour and proceeded with instructions. I did add a tsp of dijon mustard a few sprigs of fresh thyme and 2 dashes of worcestershire. Set the pressure cooker for 20 min and thickened with a little corn starch and water which is much better for thickening than flour. The Crème fraîche is a must. I purchased mine from my local market. Will add this to my winter rotation for sure.
Made this with all the ingredients and followed the directions. It was a hit! Will make this again and again.
Great recipe. Used sour cream and it came out perfectly but creme fresh would take it to another level.

I love this! I generally don't like to spend a lot of time cooking, but I'm so glad that I did. Because of covid we don't eat out anymore and I've missed having really good food. This was so worth the time!
I’ve made this recipe several times and it is delicious every single time! Used sour cream at times and Creve fraiche at times and it really doesn’t matter it’s still great.

Wow, This is the best Beef Stroganoff I have ever had! I followed the directions exactly but then had to run out while it simmered, ended up being gone for 1 1/2 hours. All juices dried up but I just added about 2 cups beef broth along with some flour and it fixed it!! Definitely will make this again! Thanks Chef John! I have been making a bunch of your recipes!

This is the absolute best beef stroganoff I have ever had. I made it according to the directions and turned out delicious. Unfortunately I had to use sour cream, since I had it on hand, but will make the other next time. I’ve made this about 3 times now and there is never anything left over. Definitely worth the time to put forth. Easy recipe just had to simmer my roast a little longer than I expected, but oh so tender and worth every minute it took to create this fabulous dish.
Made this for our 43rd. anniversary . We both Loved it . Had it with a dry red and an artichoke .
Meh.

This turned out fantastic! I removed the mushroom/garlic mixture (replaced onions with onion powder), used a roux of ¼ c flour, ¼ c butter, cooked for about 4 minutes, and added the white wine and half of the beef broth until it thickened slightly, around 1-2 minutes. Followed the recipe the rest of the way but increased the creme fraiche slightly. The base BEFORE adding the creme franchise is wonderful for a stew. Beautifully thickened, awesome flavor, simply scrumptious!
Chef John does not disappoint! Super easy recipe full of delicious bold flavours!

We loved it! My additions were 2 tbs of Worcestershire, 1 tbs Dijon. I also cut the sour cream in half. If you are using a pound of wide egg noodles I think this need more mushrooms, and more sauce. Next time I will double both. We mixed everything so we didn't butter the noodles. Delicious! My boyfriend had three servings!

Delicious! I followed the recipe exactly, except I used sirloin and an extra garlic clove. It was plenty saucy... which I really liked; however, I will probably try a scant 2T flour next time. I’ll definitely make this again.
Missing dill, very important!

This is the only beef stroganoff recipe I would use. I use sour cream because I am too lazy to make cream fraiche. Even my 2 yo loves to eat this dish. I love love love all of Chef Jonh’s recipes and videos.
Follow the recipe exactly and it came out amazing! I've been following Chef John on YouTube for a long time and try plenty of his recipes.

Always a favorite! I have to add Worcestershire, Dijon mustard, and tarragon, though. It’s just almost reflexive to do so with stroganoffs, I can’t even control it. I don’t miss the paprika other recipes include but this one excludes. I also always use Fage 5% plain Greek yogurt instead of sour cream. I don’t miss it but I’m sure sour cream purists would. Never disappoints!
Simple and sooooooo delicious. Best stroganoff recipe by far. I used sour cream and it turned out fantastic.
So delicious. One of my new favorites

This was outstanding! The house smelled soooo good. When my husband arrived home from work and smelled that yumminess, he became euphoric. I didn't have white wine, so I used red instead. I can't believe how good this turned out. Can't wait to eat the leftovers!!
This is absolutely delicious!! I made exactly per recipe. However, I did double it. I did as suggested, I got prime Chuck. Highly recommend!!
This is soooo good. I used what I had on hand - ground turkey instead of beef and red wine instead of white. I had no noodles so I used Cauliflower rice. Everyone loved it.
Delicious, and very easy to make!
I found this recipe bland & the meat tuff
Excellent dish. I love the use of Creme fraiche, giving it the creaminess without the overpowering sourness of sour cream. This sauce has a savory, rich flavor. I will definitely make again.
